etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + 央(央) (yāng, "center") = luxurious or flourishing like grass -> heroic, outstanding
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 艹(艹) to suggest lushness or abundance, with 央(央) serving as the phonetic element, conveying the idea of excellence or being outstanding.

examples.chinese: 他英勇抗敌(他英勇抗敵)！
他在英国学习(他在英國學習)，欣赏英伦风情(欣賞英倫風情)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài Yīngguó xuéxí, xīnshǎng Yīnglún fēngqíng.
examples.english: He studies in England and appreciates British style.

examples.chinese: 他的气质英气逼人(他的氣質英氣逼人)！
examples.pinyin: Tā de qìzhì yīngqì bī rén!
